intro: Calycogonium revolutum, commonly known as the velvetleaf or African morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils, making it an invasive species in some areas. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution. The plant has been studied for its potential medicinal properties and as a source of natural dyes.
